title: Rule-based versus AI-driven benefits allocation: GDPR and AIA legal implications and challenges for automation in public social security administration
research_description: This paper explores the legal implications of the GDPR and the Artificial Intelligence Act on the use of automated decision-making systems in public social security administration. It compares rule-based and AI-driven systems, focusing on how these legal frameworks influence their deployment.
research_results: The article highlights the challenges posed by GDPR and AIA to the use of fully automated decision systems in social security, with a focus on ensuring legality, fairness, and transparency. It underscores the risks of bias in AI-driven systems and the legal safeguards required under these frameworks.
future_research: Future studies could explore the impact of new AI regulations on public administrations beyond social security, and assess how these frameworks might evolve as AI technologies advance.
